intro: Erigeron strictus, commonly known as stiffleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Erigeron strictus is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
